meanings.definition: In a bad-tempered or argumentative manner.
meanings.sent1: She spoke cantankerously, refusing to listen to anyone else's opinion.
meanings.sent2: The old man always grumbled cantankerously about the noisy neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed cantankerously when it didn't get its favorite treat.
meanings.sent4: The car engine sputtered cantankerously before finally starting.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds gathered cantankerously in the sky, threatening rain.

meanings.definition: Showing an unwillingness to cooperate or be agreeable.
meanings.sent1: The cantankerously stubborn child refused to eat his vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The cantankerously old dog growled at anyone who came near its food bowl.
meanings.sent3: The cantankerously slow turtle finally reached the finish line.
meanings.sent4: The cantankerously tangled headphones took forever to unravel.
meanings.sent5: The cantankerously locked door wouldn't budge no matter how hard she pushed.
